text: Donald Owen Neely (21 December 1935 â€“ 16 June 2022) was a New Zealand cricket historian, administrator and player. He was the president of New Zealand Cricket from 2006 until 2009. He wrote over 30 books on New Zealand cricket. Neely was born in Wellington, New Zealand. A player, he played for the Wellington cricket team from 1964 until 1968 and Auckland cricket team from 1968 until 1971. Neely died on 16 June 2022 in Wellington at the age of 86.Former New Zealand Cricket president and selector Don Neely dies, age 86 ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2022 deaths Category:New Zealand cricketers Category:New Zealand writers Category:Historians Category:People from Wellington
title: Don Neely
